website_summaries.verdict: From the maker of the original solar lantern, Luci Outdoor 2.0 gives you up to 24 hours of light on a single 7-hour charge.
pros: Durable solar light with 10 white LEDs that shine in 4 modes
Top and adjustable base strap are convenient for clipping onto backpack or tent
Lasts up to 24 hours on a single 7-hour charge
cons: Button to turn the device on is flat and can be challenging to find in the dark

website_summaries.verdict: Very efficient solar charging unit that's perfect for camping, while also giving you a low price point.
pros: Runs for up to 24 hours of light after sitting in the sun all day
Lightweight lantern at only 4.4 oz., which is perfect for hiking and camping
Gives you 4 different lighting modes, including a blinking SOS mode
Has a charge level indicator light
cons: Materials may not stand up well to rugged conditions

customer_reviews.title: Theses are the 2.0 redesign that address both of the things I hated about the previous design!
customer_reviews.text: 1. If you turn them on they stay on. You don’t have to turn them back on 2. The hook on top is better quality and you can snap them onto a wire or a rail! I also thing the battery life is better and they charge faster but that may be in my head. These are what I wished the first generation were. Absolutely perfect. As you can see I bought one then bought two more
customer_reviews.author: JXD

customer_reviews.title: Great reliable light.
customer_reviews.text: Used as only light while camping for 5 weeks. Bought 2 to have plenty of time to recharge in case of cloudy condituons. Excelent light to find ny way to the toilet facilities.Lasts an amazing long time once charged. Able to use as a reading loght on even the low setting. You will not regret this purchase! Good bye toxic batteries. Now using one for car emergencies and one for my yome in case electricity goes out.
customer_reviews.author: fun adventurer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant product literally and figuratively
customer_reviews.text: wonderful product, have used it in power outages to read for hours. lights up the whole room. I have used it camping. I love the fact that I don't have to buy batteries anymore!! Doesn't take long to charge at all. the company that makes them is very socially responsible, donating some of the lanterns and profits to places without electricity such as Puerto Rico etc... I have given many of these away as gifts, and everyone loves them and finds them useful. just leave near sunny window to keep charged.
customer_reviews.author: Kvan

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Light
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly bright and amazing light output. This light is amazing -- solar (no batteries), LED lights (super-long life and vivid light), waterproof (it floats), collapsible (deflates to the size of a small pot holder) and has an adjustable strap (hangs anywhere). The perfect light.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Smith

customer_reviews.title: Brand new and does not charge fully!!
customer_reviews.text: I received the solar light and tried to charge it, but it will not fully charge. When I check the battery status, it only shows 2 out of 3. I have tried charging it in the sun for two days without success. A new product that can't even get a full charge at the get go is unacceptable. I know that rechargeable batteries lose capacity over time, but this is a brand new product. I cannot figure out how to contact support about this issue, so I am writing this review in hopes that someone that can help me will see it.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica M.

customer_reviews.title: I'm amazed with this product
customer_reviews.text: I'm amazed with this product. Some people are so smart. I purchased one as a tester for potential Operation Christmas Child boxes and this does not disappoint. I already have good quality small flashlights for my 2018 boxes, but these will be in my 2019 boxes for sure. In the meantime I'm enjoying my tester. It's bright enough on it's own, but we have found several ways to produce extra light using reflection. Place lower in the room, next to a wall. If placed near a corner it will really reflect well off a white ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Nybakken

customer_reviews.title: great lighting, weak strap
customer_reviews.text: The light was easy to use, had great lighting power and settings, is rain resistant, and so far seems to have good battery life. The downside so far, which may just be a one time flaw, is that the strap clasp broke the first time I detached it. As you can see in the picture, the strap connects at two places to provide adjustability. It came with the strap connected to the spot you see here, and it was quite firmly fastened - when I did my best to remove it, slowly applying more force, it eventually tore the plastic around the fastener. While I'm disappointed with this flaw, the light is still a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Christian McKinney

customer_reviews.title: A welcome addition
customer_reviews.text: These lights last for years. I have the original so I wanted to try the new version. So far so good. Quite a bit larger and more light output naturally. Great features. The new reflector addition is a nice touch. The original has a satin look to it's reflector. I love my original so it will stay in use. But the new kid does show promise. A welcome addition.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Q

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the original one, and just bought 3 if this new style and after several months of "testing" (fully charged it and left in a window to maintain charge) it has failed again. The charge only lasted less than 4 hours. I wanted this for emergency lighting, however this cannot be trusted.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Becker

customer_reviews.title: Very well put together.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this little happy solar lamp. everything worked the first day, it even came fully charge. the lights are really bright. Sadly, the third led that measures the charge on the battery die the second day. Then on the fourth day, the battery doesn't hold the charge has long has before. 12+ hours of fully exposed to the sun, only gives me less than 7 hours of light in the low setting. That is really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't Charte
customer_reviews.text: It lit up when new. It seemed to charge a little. Then we made sure it was in the full sun all day. The battery indicator was still blinking one dot. We turned it on, it ran for five minutes and now it is now totally dead. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mom

customer_reviews.title: What a great idea. Easy to carry, light weight, and they float.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. The light weight and eas of packing are the best. The light is very bright at night too. I love that it has a strap so I can hang it in my tent or over the table. I strap it to my pack in the day to keep it charged. Much better than my flashlight. The only problem I have is blowing them up. It was hard at first but took a few times for me to get the hang of it. I use them on my kayak as my headlight.
customer_reviews.author: Y2KTSA

customer_reviews.title: Bright and long lasting.
customer_reviews.text: Love this little light. It works well and last quite awhile. Someone is genius!
customer_reviews.author: Jouncyg

customer_reviews.title: Mine was a Dud
customer_reviews.text: I charged the light for well over seven hours and didn't get more than a few hours of light. The charge indicator showed that the battery was full, but the light lasted four hours - at most - that was at the brightest setting; even at its lowest setting, I still got less than five hours of use. I'll be trying a different model at some point soon, and I look forward to getting a better result.
customer_reviews.author: Jude1123

customer_reviews.title: 1st trip didn't work
customer_reviews.text: When I got it the light worked as a test but we don’t always buy things & use them right away. I finally took it to the field for my Cycle Oregon trip & it never worked & it had plenty of charge. I know other people who have them & they work just fine, I’m going to get another light for the hell of it but am mad that this is a throw away, $ right out the door 1st time being used. 😠
customer_reviews.author: Eric B.

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love these...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these off the recommendation of a YouTube RVer. They’re cute, super light weight, and reasonably easy to blow up. We went camping and took our 7 yr old grandson who doesn’t like complete darkness. These seemed like a perfect solution. I charged the two Lucis in a sunny window all day. The first night they provided light most of the night. (9:00-5:00am) The second night they faded by 2:00 am. The third night they were off by midnight. It’s possible I didn’t charge them long enough, but I don’t think so. I did the same thing each day and the weather was clear and sunny.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Pittman

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly awesome
customer_reviews.text: You'll be surprised how bright this thing is, and how long it stays lit. Sooo many uses for this! Only two drawbacks: 1. Takes a FULL day - no joke - to charge back up to full strength, so be ready for sun. 2. Susceptible to fingerprints on the outside and condensation on the inside after inflation (this eventually subsides).
customer_reviews.author: Kat S.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: Got them to add to my kit for emergencies, and I am amazed how bright they are, It is not bright enough to read a book if you were in a room such as a living room but it will be bright enough to definitely see and then some! I would gladly recommend it, and will be placing another order for more! I love the fact that all you have to do is sit them in some direct sunlight to let them charge. Easy to operate and they work very well!
customer_reviews.author: Michael P

customer_reviews.title: There is not any light emiting from it.
customer_reviews.text: I don't get it. There are no instructions. It does not charge. It is just a piece of plastic that blows up from a flat disc. There is a very thin dark patch on the outside. On the inside there are some circular areas with a yellow dot in each one. It does not charge or ever emit even a tiny spark of light.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Days

customer_reviews.title: Don't get a DUD, like me..
customer_reviews.text: I have a dud, certainly. It holds air. 12+ hrs solar input. Holds no charge. 2hrs at best. Then..totally kaput. Black out. Argh... I raved about it to EVERYONE..now I have to hide it, for shame.
customer_reviews.author: Denise D.

customer_reviews.title: won't charge
customer_reviews.text: The brightness and weight is exactly what I was hoping for. I had it on all day and most the night and the indicator showed I only used half the storage! It seemed like a perfect lantern! Then I tried to charge it. I live in the PNW and there is low light and shorter days so I was expecting a longer charge time. But, I've had it in the window for a full week and there has been no movement to the battery indicator. That's just not going to work for my intended use as an emergency lantern.
customer_reviews.author: S. Morgenstern

customer_reviews.title: Love them! Power outage perfect
customer_reviews.text: We had a power outage and I was so glad I purchased these for camping. Bright enough to light up my living room (though I wouldn’t say bright enough to read by unless your next to it) and our other Luci frosted version we placed on our headboard to read to our toddler. They charged up fine & lasted until our power came back on (I think it was about 7hrs) and still had life left. The clear version is a bright led/blue light that’s good for viewing as much as possible but we much prefer the color of the frosted one. I’m very pleased with both these products and will purchase again if these ever conk out.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen C

customer_reviews.title: Took this guy camping a few weeks ago
customer_reviews.text: And had I known how bright it was, I wouldn't have scrounged around Craigslist and Offerup for standard propane lanterns. It does attract quite a few gnats and other tiny flying pests through the a "see through" netted ceiling, if you hang it from the top of the interior of the tent ... so just FYI you may not want to turn it on until you're actually inside the tent. It was a minor annoyance for a light that I thought would be a novelty but ended up being quite a decent lantern. It's going to be part of my emergency earthquake kit/bag.
customer_reviews.author: D. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing battery life
customer_reviews.text: With rolling blackouts in California, I bought these. I am impressed with battery life, amount of light, and user friendly. The first picture is on high level and second one is on low level. This light isn’t the brightest for reading but great if you need to light a room or two. My kids keep them in there room and it stays on all night.
customer_reviews.author: New To religion

customer_reviews.title: What a great concept.
customer_reviews.text: Solar powered camp light (or for any time the lights go out). The light is not so bright as to be blinding (like a lot of camp lanterns are) but is just a nice light for walking between campsites after dark. Or for finding your campsite after dark. In a primitive campground with no lights, one person left a Luci light on her truck so she could find it when returning after dark. It DOES take time to charge it up initially. It took me 3 days initially but it is winter and the sun is low in the sky (low UV). It collapses down to nothing for packing, and floats if it ends up in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Grayranch

customer_reviews.title: These little lights are AWESOME and neighbors were all jealous
customer_reviews.text: Blow me Irma. Hurricane Irma blew through here knocking out power for, well this is our 4th day and still no power. These little lights are AWESOME and neighbors were all jealous. I even through one in the pool at night to monitor level since pool was about to overflow. They give off great light for size. I charged them in sun about a month ago so honestly I figured they would need to be recharged when Irma came knocking ... NOPE they held charge and turned right on. They are in driveway right now recharging for first time. I'd love to try out the colorful ones but Irma hit our wallet hard so I'll get them when I can.
customer_reviews.author: Mig

customer_reviews.title: Luci lights are fantastic
customer_reviews.text: On my boat (svGuidingLight.com) I have outdoor lighting for my cockpit, but no matter how "waterproof" they say the wired LED strips are, I seem to have to replace them every other year. that is until I found Luci Lights. These self contained lights are fully encaspulated in plastic so the salt air will not ruin them, they are solar powered so there is no drain on the batteries, and I can move them around as needed. the best part is they give off even more light then I had before!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shane McClellan

customer_reviews.title: Everybody needs one of these for walking at night
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase, with covid and hot summer days, I now take walk at night and I bought a second one to carry with me at night, it is bright, it lights the road, but more importantly, it is a safety feature for myself, other people and cars can see me from a distance. I don't walk on the road, always on sidewalk unless I have to pass for social distancing. I feel much safer with this light when I walk as the sky gets dark. Battery life is great and you won't be sorry to have one.
customer_reviews.author: X-Fans

customer_reviews.title: they work
customer_reviews.text: wish I had these while going thru hurricane micheal, no electric for 3 weeks, these would have come in handy. they light light up a room , you can read by them. they charge easy just leave them in the sun, they hold a charge for a long time. I use one when I take the dog out, nice white lights. recommend them, they are good for emergencies.i will be buying more of them.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mccormick

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Great for camping and or hiking/camping. Lite. Efficient. Solar powered. Lasts many hours. Easy to use and pack up. Similar to a beach ball. Just deflate. Great, stellar idea.
customer_reviews.author: Margie Bardsley

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't i think of this...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. Definitely can stay on all night on low. Still need to see if it makes it through the night on medium.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: A MUST BUY for camping or survival
customer_reviews.text: This is all u need light weight, size of a coaster, long lasting, durable thick plastic, very bright, great for dark nights, floats, charge meter, endless power as long as the solar panel lasts. So far about 2 weeks i havent charged it once in a dark room still full power turning it on for a few min at a time
customer_reviews.author: Tim Smith 8526

customer_reviews.title: Dependable-Lite weight -Powerful-Well made
customer_reviews.text: I love these lights!!! Have given away many as gifts. Nice to know my family and friends would have an emergency survival light in case needed. Very light, floats and well made. In fact ony one light is needed to have my little teardrop T@B trailer lit up to cook by or read a book. Compact, easy to use. Holds a charge...lasts a long time. I have never had one fail me so far. Started using these in 2016 when my battery on my trailer went dead. I keep one in my car also. Battery flashlights have failed me once too often.
customer_reviews.author: AlohaTink

customer_reviews.title: Could be great
customer_reviews.text: I really like this light. The reason for 3 stars is it will not fully charge no matter how long it is left in the sun. I emailed customer service to see it it could be exchanged. They did reply that they were in a lock down and would respond at a later time. It has been two months now. I don't mind paying full price for a product that works perfectly, but I do mind getting something that does not perform as it should. Disappointed and will not try another.
customer_reviews.author: drynard

customer_reviews.title: plenty of light, and it's still working after a year and a half
customer_reviews.text: This thing provides plenty of light. It works great. I leave it in a window in my van during the day, and it provides enough light for the evening. Nice and bright, easy to use, holds a charge, folds down small. Would definitely recommend. I bought mine in July 2017 and now it's the end of January, 2019. Great for camping and bike/backpacking trips. I have not taken it on the water, but I will. (Oh, the strap is kind of cheesey, and will probably tear off, but then it won't get in the way of the solar panel--mine still has the strap, but I fold it back so it does not block the solar charging panel.)
customer_reviews.author: Kimbo

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable handle ripped after 4 days
customer_reviews.text: 3 Stars due to the adjustable handle ripping apart after 4 days. I thought I was being as gentle as possible with it, darn! Does the hot sun weaken the plastic? Charges fast, light works well, sufficient brightness, meets all for my requirements. Unfortunately the handle is not met to be opened and closed 2-3 times a day. Update 2nd tap or button on the handle has also ripped apart. Going to try crazy glue. Without the adjustable you can only hang the light one way.
customer_reviews.author: Grrr...

customer_reviews.title: Even my younger brother was like wow that's five times brighter than I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: Just received my outdoor 2.0 today and I am completely impressed . Seems really well-made and the brightness on the brightest setting was far and away brighter than I thought it was going to be. Even my younger brother was like wow that's five times brighter than I was expecting. I am sooooo happy I discovered this awesome lantern and I'm definitely gonna be buying several more. This first one was a. " tester " to see if it lived up to the hype of all the five star reviews, and believe me it does with flying colors .... Happy in Alaska....
customer_reviews.author: paul w nott

customer_reviews.title: Awesome solar light!
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for candles or using batteries. Editing review, Luci light needs to check on their Quality Control before they package them. I purchased 10 to give as gifts, only to find out that one of the lights can't inflate because the seam wasn't glued and now I can't return it because of the return policy date due to a defect.
customer_reviews.author: Ika strip

customer_reviews.title: Bright solar area lighthing
customer_reviews.text: Charges quickly then runs all night on low. A lot of viewers have a problems opening the valve but I haven't had that issue. To open, simply squeeze the largest part of the valve body (not the small neck). The valve opens easily then simply pull the two disc parts in opposite directions slowly. The light body will inflate then a few breaths will take care of the rest. There's a reset procedure to calibrate the power meter available on their website. I'm not sure if it makes any difference in the actual run time.
customer_reviews.author: John Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend. Excellent product. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
customer_reviews.text: Luci lights are functional, light weight, convenient, & bright with good battery life. They are water resistant standing-up to rain easily. I have been using them for years primarily while sailing, but use them elsewhere, too. They are ideal for any camping. I travel with one as it is handy for reading or dimly lit spaces. They are long lasting. (I ordered this one because I left my others on the boat.) Highly recommend. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Supremely...

customer_reviews.title: A lot to recharge
customer_reviews.text: 2nd generation so far not impressionable, needs long recharge to lite for several hours. Like the charge level indicator, and it’s true to level, leave it out all day in direct sunlight but hasn’t recharged fully yet. We r in key west which has full and direct sun. We have first generation and thought 2nd would b better after 4 years, haven’t seen progress in tech here
customer_reviews.author: Mike Mascia

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed. I live off grid and hate having to buy expensive batteries (and the throw-away waste) for the 3 battery powered lights I have. I had hoped these would be a good solution. Unfortunately it is not nearly as bright as reviews led me to believe. I probably should have looked for the lumens amount. I'm guessing 20-30. It also takes several days to charge to full and the light only lasts about 3 hours on high. Would be fine in the summer when we have much longer hours of daylight but not in the winter; but that's when light is needed most.
customer_reviews.author: gipsichik

customer_reviews.title: Great lights!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for our sailboat! They are perfect for lighting the cockpit in the evening. String lights proved problematic due to the salt air corroding the wiring, etc. these charge easily, last a long time and are compact when you need them to be! I loaned some of these to my brother who was without power for several weeks post Hurricane Michael. He said using a couple together was perfect for doing clean up tasks, etc after dark. I now have around 6 of these; some for the boat and some for emergencies. These would make great gift items!
customer_reviews.author: Dana S. Helmuth

customer_reviews.title: Dependable as ever!  A great light.
customer_reviews.text: I am a Luci Light owner for at least 5 years now. I love them. My first Luci light is still functioning, but I can tell the battery is dying because it is swelling and deforming the light a bit. I figured it was time to order a new one before the old battery dies. A note on this Luci light. They have added a battery gauge so you know how much charge is in the battery. A nice edition to a great light.
customer_reviews.author: Ronrude

customer_reviews.title: battery does not last.
customer_reviews.text: nice light. but, battery does not last. the grid does not charge. it only lasts 2 hrs at most. I worked well for 1 week, and then dropped off. returning product.
customer_reviews.author: Ji

customer_reviews.title: I found it easy to use and very durable
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the original light for some time. I found it easy to use and very durable. The version 2.0 is the same as the original light except it has a helpful battery level indicator. It comes with temperature specifications and if you abide by them, the light will operate perfectly. I use this light as both an emergency light at home and it is so small and light that I hike with it. You can't go wrong with this.
customer_reviews.author: EJB

customer_reviews.title: Really Cool Lantern
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camping/tent lantern. It can be adjusted from extremely bright, to very low light depending on your use. The light charges up quickly in the sun and the battery last for a long time. The only issue I have with it is that I wish I would have gotten the pro version so that I could also have the two-way USB charging option. It would be nice to be able to charge the battery up prior to a camping trip, or have it ready to go in case of a power outage.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should
customer_reviews.text: I keep this propped on a window sill and it has always been ready to go when the power goes out. It will light up a 12x12 room well enough to see other people and move around. Can even read by it if close enough. Much safer than candles and takes up less room than a lantern.
customer_reviews.author: O. McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: I love Luci
customer_reviews.text: The Luci Outdoor 2.0 is another winner from Mpowerd. These little solar powered lights are so practical. Let the air out, and they are flat and pack easily. The adjustable handle makes the 2.0 more versatile although with the right gizmo, hanging it is easy. The Luci has been a great gift, and its features make people smile. Luci’s solar panel works well even on partly cloudy days. Luci 2.0 is an A+ camping 🏕 light 💡 at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Idaho resident

customer_reviews.title: Great portable light!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these Luci lights and used them camping. I hooked them to the outside of my tent and let the sun charge them up during the day and had the lights providing light at night for my tent area. Love how they compress and inflate back up again. They provide ample lighting and I like the various light modes. Great compact lights to have either for camping or even for when the power goes out.
customer_reviews.author: edKHSgal

customer_reviews.title: Nice lamp
customer_reviews.text: I have brought this with me on camping trips for several days at a time. It is been a year and it is still working. I charge it either at camp or hang it on my pack while hiking. The multiple light settings are very useful. The lamp is light and does not take up much space. The only improvement I would like is to make it easier to puff up. It can be difficult at times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best lighting source for a minimalist or hiker.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the greatest lighting gadgets ever created. For a minimalist, this is a must have. I have owned many of these. They are very bright and keep a charge for a while. They are waterproof and will float. They store discreetly and are perfect for putting at the top of your pack while hiking so it can charge. If you are a reader, this is a perfect and efficient source of light to keep you engaged in that story while curled up in your tent or hammock. This improved version has a lighted meter to keep up with the charge capacity. I have owned many because I always forget them at the trailhead while they are charging.
customer_reviews.author: JACK Dismas

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding light. Super compact and easy.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly magic. Incredible product. I have a battery/solar lamp from another company that cost twice as much and doesn't light as well. Will mood light a large bedroom, well dispersed 70-100 lumens. Hang it above a table and you wont need another one while camping. Beats the hell out of lugging lanterns or flashlight lamps. Great for camping, backpacking, emergencies, off the grid. I'm going to buy more for sure.
customer_reviews.author: AlldoneAbe

customer_reviews.title: Awesome light to keep charged for power outages!
customer_reviews.text: We love these lights. Our neighborhood loses power multiple times throughout the year so I keep the lights hanging in windows so that they are charged and ready anytime we need them. Great light that you can even read by. And at the end of the night when we are without power I will leave one in in the hall and one on in the bathrooms and usually there is still a faint glow in the am.(then just set in window to charge again) This purchase was for Christmas gifts. I think everyone should have one in hand !
customer_reviews.author: My3Chicks

customer_reviews.title: Charges ONLY by solar
customer_reviews.text: The light is great. The only reason I didn’t give it five stars is because it doesn’t have a way to charge with power cord which I didn’t read well enough to realize before purchasing. I would have liked that option. Many days it doesn’t get fully charged before dark. I got it for stays in Uganda which is basically on the equator and the sun isn’t long enough to charge it fully on many days.
customer_reviews.author: Julyrose1026

customer_reviews.title: I could not get it to open up to charge.
customer_reviews.text: I followed directions and cannot get it to extend enough to charge. I am not happy with it at all, but it beyond the return period so I am stuck with it. A waste of money. I purchased it to go camping this Fall, but didn't try to use it until return period was up. What a joke!
customer_reviews.author: Bailey's mom

customer_reviews.title: Loving it so far..
customer_reviews.text: I love the Lucy. It came charged out of the box. It's been shining bright since. I started using it as an extra light in my dark house at night. I will probably buy more. I live in Florida and these would be great to keep around for storm season. I wish they came with red bulbs so I could take them to the beach at night. *red lights are better for the beach critters little eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One use - ripped the two snaps
customer_reviews.text: I got this for backpacking and it is lightweight, very bright and the solar panel makes it super easy to charge while you're on trail. However, I had this hanging from my bag to charge and once I went to unsnap the lantern from my backpack, the snap ripped off. Luckily, there's a second snap which I then used for the rest of the day. Once we got to camp the same thing happened, trying to undo the snap ripped it completely off. The sun probably had most to do with the material being "rip-able" after charging on my pack but you would think something that is solar charging would be a bit more sturdy after some sunshine.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: These are great. We keep one on the back deck as ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great. We keep one on the back deck as a flashlight to use for getting to the hot tub in the dark. It's waterproof so I don't worry about it falling in. Just keeping them in the house keeps them fully charged all the time. We also store them in our emergency kit and take them out about every 6 months to charge. It does take a few days indoors to bring to a full charge when they are new or low on charge so plan accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: labdesigner

customer_reviews.title: Better than a flashlight
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my neighbor boys ages 8 and 10. We live in Minnesota and they are perfect to help light up their skating rink, take out their dog, sit by the campfire. I have two in my home. We use them all the time. Especially great if the power goes out. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Bright enough for small to medium areas.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 7 day hike in the Smoky Mountains. More of a directional light than omni-directional lantern. The on/off button is hard to find in the dark. Clipped onto my backpack during the day, it seemed to charge well enough for use in the evenings (I only used it for around 30min each night). Bright enough for small to medium areas (tents and/or GSM shelters).
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Taylor

customer_reviews.title: If you Need light This is The One!
customer_reviews.text: I love these lights! They are light weight and you can drop them in your backpack and use as flashlight but much lighter than anything else that emits that much light. I would have loved to have them when we hiked the Grande Canyon. Being able to recharge with the sun would have been incredible. We were there 4 days and it would have solved many problems and reduced the weight we had to carry!!
customer_reviews.author: Snowgoddess

customer_reviews.title: These are Great Lights
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these and my friends have some too. We all love them! I've been using the first two I purchased at a brick and mortar store for years and they still work great and the charge lasts a long time. I know they seem pricey, but they are worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Great little lantern
customer_reviews.text: I knew someone that had one of these a few years ago. I finally started hiking again and wanted one for myself. I love this thing!! I clip it to my pack and it provides the perfect amount of light in the tent. I haven't tested the battery life as I usually just fall asleep shortly after climbing in the tent for the night. Everyone needs one for camping!
customer_reviews.author: C. Durfee

customer_reviews.title: What a product!
customer_reviews.text: Pro: it is light weight, easily charged (built-in solar panel), and adjustable brightness works well (also very bright). It works as well as other similar products from REI that is over double the price. Con: none Overall: I recommend this to my families and friends
customer_reviews.author: henry's_approved

customer_reviews.title: This is one awesome product.
customer_reviews.text: This collapses flat so you can leave it in a window to charge then expand it an use it when needed. The light is adjustable and can be quite bright. I've run it all night with no problem so it seems to have a very long life on a charge. Way better than any traditional battery/gas operated emergency light or camp light. This is simply a great product!
customer_reviews.author: D. Kam

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those things you go "really?" when someone else is using it, and then you go buy one. Very light weight, charges while walking and you can toss it on the ground to illuminate the stove or hang it from the tent while setting up bedding. I am surprised by how long the battery lasts. No negatives that I could find.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Jack

customer_reviews.title: Bright light, good quality, cannot recommend them more highly!
customer_reviews.text: Have used these in the past in the aftermath of Hurricane Maria in Puerto Rico, and loved them ! Reordered them again for my sister who's enduring power outages in California due to the wildfires. It arrived next day as promised, and is exactly as described. LOVE THEM !!! Very bright, and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: John Palma

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: A friend has a bunch of these they use for camping, and recommended them so highly l I got one for our Hurricane Shelf. I fired it up the first time to use on our back porch when I want some light but don't want to turn on the lights. It charged without having to be in direct sunlight, and is great. Blows up easily, and does not deflate unless you pinch the valve. Goes back into the box for easy storage. I think I'll get 1 or 2 more before Storm Season hits.
customer_reviews.author: A.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice light
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a Christmas gift, i have one and love it.. Backpacking
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bowling

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC
customer_reviews.text: I keep 4 deflated lights in window for emergency. Used for 2 hour power loss. I diidn't have to check for battery corrosion, or search for these (kept in window). Bright lighting we were able to see way better than a flashlight because the light is a lantern. Great for camping even when it rained all day you don't worry because it is waterproof. They look extra cool in the swimming pool.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Great light, very bright and holds a charge
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing! I inflated it and set it outside for most of a sunny day. Later that night I turned it on and it was so bright. better yet, weeks later this clear plastic thing that looks like a toy was still fully inflated and still produced a bright light! true, I did’t leave it turned on for very long. If you don’t have one I would recommend getting one.
customer_reviews.author: Yakki

customer_reviews.title: Great for camp and camping
customer_reviews.text: Great for camp and camping. My kids go to a camp without electricity and this helps them find the bathroom at night without attracting too many bugs. They also use it in their cabins to play cards, etc. Great for walking to events at night during the summer or on the beach. Charges well. Completely solar. Gives off a ton of light. When not used collaspses to about an inch as easy to pack. Also good bday gift for camp buddies.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bell

customer_reviews.title: I recommend purchasing several of these
customer_reviews.text: I keep these in the glove compartment of my vehicles. Every few month, take them out to recharge...just in case. Everyone should keep one or two in their vehicles. For those in areas prone to power outages, I recommend purchasing several of these. They take up almost no space, yet provide adequate level of light output (depending on your needs of course).
customer_reviews.author: Mike Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Only charged 2/3 full
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on last November 2017 when hurricane Maria hit the island September 20, 2017. The lamp have a nice design and good ilumination, but didn’t charged full the solar panel. Only charge up to 2/3 full :(. , , so I am disappointed in this product because of this.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love these, have bought 2 so far. First one has held up very well to near constant outdoor use. Second one the snap on the strap broke after only about a week inside sitting in a window to use as a back up light while we redo some wiring in our livingroom. So light part still awesome, but don't trust the plastic straps.
customer_reviews.author: Islandlasse

customer_reviews.title: Great for Background Illumination
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What a find! We use this to give us background illumination in a dark tent. This eliminates the need to turn on a flashlight all the time. On the low setting, it lasts all night on a day's charge on the dashboard. Note that to inflate or deflate the lantern, you need to pinch the base of the inflation stem. I found that blowing air into it using my mouth resulted in fogging. It didn't affect the light much, but looked stranger. We now plan to purchase the color version of this lamp!
customer_reviews.author: Dee NTop Contributor: Amazon Echo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect light for use on a boat!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a very compact light that was rechargeable for use on our sailboat were storage is a premium. This little light works fantastic! Small, lightweight, bright, rechargeable and it floats. If you are on a boat, this is great product and I highly recommend it. Also is great for camping and hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Adrenaline Seeker

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have used these lights camping around 20 different trips, I leave them on low when it starts getting dark and they stay on all night this being 12 hours depending on the time of the year and they will still be on the next morning. I found that to get a full charge they have to stay in the sunlight for 5 to 7 days. They are great lights I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Survived Hurricane Florence
customer_reviews.text: I bought this solar lamp because easy to take in my kayak trips but set it outside on a bush in the sun to charge a couple of days before Hurricane Florence last September. I forgot about it and it was gone after the storm. Today it showed up on my sidewalk apparently having been blown up in a tree that was trimmed a day or two ago. Walla, it's dirty, but still inflated and works. Unbelievable!! Buy one - it's a great alternative light source!
customer_reviews.author: Seeker

customer_reviews.title: Great for backpacking!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This light is amazing!!! Very bright and super lightweight. Its great for backpacking. It gets very small so you can pack it up easily or strap it to the outside of your pack (it has little handles on the bottom and top). When we are camping on no burn days two of these lit up our whole campsite. Battery life is surprisingly long. You can "charge" them and they can last a few nights. I charged them when I first got them and put them in a dark closet for a few months took them out and they were fully charged.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Odd Packaging
customer_reviews.text: Irritated because it came with a big sticker right over the solar charging area that took 10 minutes to remove with goo-gone and windex. Will update if/when I get it charged. /Update/ It seemed to charge okay once the sticker was off.
customer_reviews.author: West Coast Dreamer

customer_reviews.title: The straps used to secure the light with break easily and can't be repaired and there is no other ...
customer_reviews.text: The straps used to secure the light with break easily and can't be repaired and there is no other way to hang it once they break. I love these lights too because they are bright and hold a charge really well. We live on a boat and they are perfect for conserving battery power and adding extra lights around the deck and in the cabin
customer_reviews.author: kathryn williams

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Bought two for my son for Christmas, for his new apartment. Then a couple of days ago, his power went out. He was going to find some candles and then recalled the solar lanterns. He was thrilled that he could just press a button and illuminate a entire room. And on a lower brightness setting, they last all night. So I bought 6 more to give to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Brent O. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Puts out a lot of light, great solar device. Quick and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have a few Lucy lights, they work great and put out a lot of light. Just one thing. The on button is very small and flat. I use glow in dark nail polish and drop a raised circle over on button so I can see or feel in dark. It’s solar, easy to use and a good value while camping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple, lightweight, good for backpacking, it works.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so light and easy to use. It's simple. I haven't really floated it in water. I've used it like a flashlight and a lamp. Very good tent lamp. I have not used it outside in a group setting though. If you want me to nit pick - it doesn't have an LED to tell me that it's currently charging or not, but I don't really care. My previous lamp was bulky. This one is super light which is important for backpackers and it's easy to stuff away somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Greatest invention ever
customer_reviews.text: I took the luci 1 on a 2200 mile hike. It was awesome, great for cooking at camp and lighting a tent. Battery life was great. I just got my luci 2 in and so far it appears to be even better. These things are genius and they weigh nothing. If they were $30 id still be happy to pay it.
customer_reviews.author: etownninja

customer_reviews.title: love this lamp
customer_reviews.text: this thing is so amazing. its only 4 ounces, waterproof, gives off more than enough light, is solar powered and has 3 modes and a charge indicator. took this backpacking and was so worth it. easily hung from a tree branch, some cording, as well as in the tent. this will not be our go to camping lantern whether car camping or backpacking its great for both.
customer_reviews.author: JNO-LVX

customer_reviews.title: Great solar light
customer_reviews.text: Works quite well for my son and his sail boat. It even floats. Light last quite awhile on a charge. Remember to charge it in full sun for a few hours and you will be good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helps when electricity is out
customer_reviews.text: Nice little device. I used it during elec. outages. Light not quite bright enough for comfortable reading. And the snap strap broke right away. Also, does not come with instructions. I had to go to manufacturer's web site to learn how long it takes to charge. 7 hours, by the way. After about 9 hours of use, the lantern requires charging.
customer_reviews.author: Susan H.

customer_reviews.title: I love these lanterns (I've had multiple of the original versions)
customer_reviews.text: I love these lanterns (I've had multiple of the original versions), but the 2.0 version that arrived did not have an adjustable strap as advertised and pictured in the amazon listing. I would not have paid the additional cost for the 2.0 version had it not been for the adjustable strap feature, so I am unfortunately disappointed with this most recent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Worked great at first
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first. About the third time I used it. The on off bottom broke. It is totally useless now. And can not be returned because it's been longer than 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald J.

customer_reviews.title: Neat product but quality seems to lack a bit.
customer_reviews.text: Good concept and charge seems to last most of the night if you have it in the sun all day. One of ours has an LED that is burnt out right out of the box. The air fill port is difficult to access as the bottom is a bit rigid and doesn't flex as well as most inflatables.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Donnelly

customer_reviews.title: Great solar light
customer_reviews.text: This is so compact & easily portable. It lets off a ton of light but beware that because of the clear nature of it, it can get very bright. I prefer the frosted version of this, but this one serves the same purpose - it's just a more stark light. I love that it's waterproof & charges great in full sun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t work as well as the older ones..
customer_reviews.text: We have an older version that stays charged for months, literally! Pulled it out of camping gear in October hasn’t seen light since June and works great, still bright! These new ones only have hours and start to dim then die.
customer_reviews.author: Matty B

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: My parents got some from a previous hurricane aid so I bought some to have other for my home because they were really useful. I think they are expensive but for this season is something I am willing to pay. I experienced a lot of power outages and remember having only the candles and the light of my cellphone to illuminate my house and those were terrible times. So far they are good, and I have already used them to get around the house at night just by placing them at different spots.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Pretty neat!
customer_reviews.text: I got the idea to add these into the Operation Christmas Child shoebox my family packs every year from a friend and I thought it was a genius idea. I did not blow the light up but it was somewhat charged and got pretty bright. Not sure about the battery life so I hope it holds up where ever it ends up.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: If you don't have one of these, you need to get one!
customer_reviews.text: Best thing to come along in a while. I use mine for camping a couple times a year and the new model with the adjustable strap is a big plus. I use it more at home during the rest of the year-dark corners in closets, watering under the Christmas tree, late night when I don't want to turn on lights, POWER OUTAGES, anytime you might use a flashlight. You will not be disappointed. I've given three as gifts and the recipients love them!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck of all trades

customer_reviews.title: Innovative, functional—I recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I love innovation that is practical and functional. This light fits the bill. Durable and easy to use, this light throws out a ton of light if you want it, or just a little light if you need it. Charges in a day, and the button that allows you to see the charge level is great. It lasts a long time. We use it for car camping, and charge it on the dashboard as we go. I wonder why it took so long for someone to come up with this. I'm glad Luci did it!
customer_reviews.author: Middle American Homemaker

customer_reviews.title: Fail
customer_reviews.text: Not even 2 months old and not charging correctly now. Gets to half chsrge and quits, doesn't last long.
customer_reviews.author: OhJustMe

product_meta.title: MPOWERD Luci Outdoor 2.0: Solar Inflatable Light
feature_bullets: This extremely durable and lightweight lantern is completely powered by the sun, no additional batteries needed. Set it in direct sunlight for 7 hours and Luci Outdoor 2.0 lasts up to 24 hours on a single charge
With 10 cool white LEDs and up to 75 lumens, Luci Outdoor 2.0 is a clean, reliable source of light to keep you out of the dark, no matter how far off the grid you go
4 modes to light any scene: low, medium, high, 1 second flashing
Rugged outdoor lantern, perfect for camping, hiking, biking, kayaking, sailing, fishing, paddle boarding and more
Features top and adjustable base strap - convenient for clipping onto a backpack, hanging in a tent or stringing up wherever you need light
Weighs less than most mobile phones at 4.4 oz. / 125 g

Luci Outdoor 2.0 is ideal for any emergency situation, especially when the unexpected happens. Rechargeable, durable, and waterproof (rated IP67), Luci Outdoor 2.0 can be used as a tool for both first responders and those who have been directly impacted.
Charge level indicator that lets you know exactly when to recharge your light in the sun. Operating temp- 32ºF – 113ºF (0ºC – 45ºC)
MPOWERD offers a 1-year manufacturer’s warranty on all MPOWERD products sold by authorized sellers
